results.title: The Keto Diet’s Most Controversial Champion

image.alt_text: An illustration of a scientist looking at a test tube rack filled with miscellaneous items.

results.dek: A chemist once at the center of an era-defining sports scandal now is eager to improve your health.

social.share_text: Patrick Arnold went to prison for his role in one of the biggest scandals in professional sports. Then he got a message from a desperate scientist. @samuelapple reports on what the pair's partnership might now mean for disease treatment:
social.seo_title: Keto for Disease Treatment: A Notorious Ex-Con's Unlikely Role

results.title: Apes Might Know That You Don’t Know What They Know

image.caption: How much do apes understand the minds of others?

results.dek: The latest volley in a decades-long debate about apes’ theory of mind involved one scientist dressing up as King Kong and stealing from his colleague.

social.share_text: Are apes able to understand that others might have distinct beliefs and knowledge about the world? And that those beliefs might be inaccurate? A new study suggests that they might be, @edyong209 reports:
social.seo_title: Do Apes Have a Theory of Mind?

results.title: How America Ends

image.attribution: Photograph by Sam Kaplan; prop styling by Brian Byrne

authors.name: Yoni Appelbaum
authors.short_bio: Senior editor at The Atlantic, where he oversees the Ideas section

results.dek: A tectonic demographic shift is under way. Can the country hold together?

social.share_text: A strong center-right party could wall off more extreme right-wing movements and help save America, @YAppelbaum writes.
social.seo_title: Moderate Republicans Can Save America

results.title: Trump Is Surrounded

image.alt_text: President Trump outside the White House in January

results.dek: The president thrives on having an opponent to villainize. With impeachment, there are too many to choose from.

social.share_text: Trump thrives on having an opponent to villainize. But with impeachment, there are too many to choose from, @PeterAtlantic writes:
social.seo_title: Trump's Long List of Impeachment Enemies

results.title: The Simplest Test of Cognitive Decline
results.dek: As age factors more urgently in politics, a basic exam could evaluate who remains fit for office.

social.share_text: What does presidential fitness really mean? It's not about physical health, @jameshamblin writes, but cognitive capacity. And that can easily be tested.
social.seo_title: Trump, Biden, Sanders: How Old Is Too Old to Be President?

results.title: The Dark Psychology of Social Networks
results.dek: Why it feels like everything is going haywire

social.share_text: “Human beings evolved to gossip, preen, manipulate, and ostracize,” @JonHaidt and @TobiasRose write. That’s why the gladiatorial circus of social media so easily lures us in, even when we know that it can make us cruel and shallow.
social.seo_title: Social Media Is Warping Democracy

results.title: Stop Waiting for a Savior

image.alt_text: William Taylor (right) and George Kent (left) are sworn in to testify before the House Intelligence Committee on Capitol Hill.

authors.name: Quinta Jurecic
authors.short_bio: Contributing writer at The Atlantic and managing editor of Lawfare

results.dek: A public once enamored of Robert Mueller now turns its eyes to a cadre of career diplomats.

social.share_text: "The whole appeal of these civil servants is how old-school they are, how they seem to represent a set of values that predates the Trumpian insistence that nothing matters," writes @qjurecic:
social.seo_title: William Taylor and George Kent Aren't Going to Save Us

results.title: The GOP Won’t Disavow Trump, but Nikki Haley Has Another Strategy

image.alt_text: Nikki Haley and Donald Trump sit together at the UN.

authors.name: Peter Beinart
authors.short_bio: Professor of journalism at the City University of New York

results.dek: The former UN ambassador presents herself as the leader who, without ever renouncing Trump, can heal the divisions his presidency has caused.

social.share_text: "She’s done a better job than almost anyone of remaining popular with both Trumpists and the pre-Trump establishment alike, and at 47, she’s a likely presidential candidate in the years ahead," writes @PeterBeinart about Nikki Haley:
social.seo_title: Disavowing Trump Isn't Part of Nikki Haley's Long Game
social.share_title: The GOP Won’t Disavow Trump, but Nikki Haley Has Another Strategy

results.title: Venice Underwater: The Highest Tide in 50 Years
results.dek: A record-setting acqua alta has left much of Venice submerged, following stormy conditions blowing in from the Adriatic Sea.

social.share_text: Photos of Venice Underwater: The Highest Tide in 50 Years—via @TheAtlPhoto
social.share_dek: A record-setting "acqua alta" has left much of Venice submerged, following stormy conditions blowing in from the Adriatic Sea.

results.title: Executive Privilege Should Have No Power When It Comes to an Impeachment

image.alt_text: The inside of the U.S. House of Representatives.

results.dek: The same rules don’t apply now that the House has begun a formal impeachment inquiry.

social.share_text: "The administration is currently asserting not only that the qualified executive privilege applies to impeachment, but that the privilege remains so important, even in impeachment, that it warrants absolute, unqualified protection," writes @jshaub:
social.seo_title: Executive Privilege Should Not Be Part of Impeachment

results.title: Donald Trump Is All Alone
results.dek: Presidents have long relied on attentive aides to help them cope with the stresses of office. Not Trump.

social.share_text: Presidents have long relied on attentive aides to help them cope with the stresses of office. But Trump doesn't have anyone like that, @PeterAtlantic writes:
social.seo_title: Donald Trump Is All Alone in the White House

results.title: The Exposure of the Republican Party

image.alt_text: Devin Nunes speaks with Jim Jordan and Stephen Castor.

authors.name: Peter Wehner
authors.short_bio: Contributing writer at The Atlantic and senior fellow at EPPC

results.dek: The GOP will not be a great or good party until those who lead it straighten their backbone.

social.share_text: "What was on display on Capitol Hill on Wednesday was not simply an impeachment inquiry into an unscrupulous president," writes @Peter_Wehner. "It was the ongoing, deepening complicity and corruption of the party he leads."
social.seo_title: Trump's Republican Party Needs to Live Within the Truth

results.title: The Hong Kong Protesters Aren’t Driven by Hope

image.alt_text: Protesters take cover behind boards during a protest in the Mong Kok area of Hong Kong.

results.dek: “We might as well go down fighting.”

social.share_text: "We might as well go down fighting," a protester tells @zeynep in Hong Kong, which appears to be descending into chaos.
social.seo_title: Hong Kong Protests: Inside the Chaos

results.title: Google’s Totally Creepy, Totally Legal Health-Data Harvesting
results.dek: Google is an emerging health-care juggernaut, and privacy laws weren’t written to keep up.

social.share_text: Recent partnerships mean Google has access to a whole lot of medical data. But even before that, it already knew many intimate details about your health, @sidneyfussell writes.
social.seo_title: Google, Project Nightingale, and All Your Health Data

results.title: The Dishonesty of the Abortion Debate

image.attribution: Erik McGregor / LightRocket / Carolyn Van Houten / The Washington Post / Getty / The Atlantic
image.alt_text: Two images: a protestor holding a sign that reads "Abortion Is Freedom" and protestors holding anti-abortion signs

authors.name: Caitlin Flanagan
authors.short_bio: Contributing writer at The Atlantic and author of Girl Land

results.dek: Why we need to face the best arguments from the other side

social.share_text: “The argument for abortion, if made honestly, requires many words,” @CaitlinPacific writes.  “The argument against it doesn’t take even a single word … This is not an argument anyone is going to win.”
social.seo_title: Abortion Is an Unwinnable Argument

results.title: Boris Johnson Is Not Britain’s Donald Trump. Jeremy Corbyn Is.
results.dek: Corbyn and Trump are both populists and in a battle with ‘the swamp.’ Brexit aside, Johnson is not.

social.share_text: Corbyn and Trump are both populists and in a battle with ‘the swamp.’ Brexit aside, Johnson is not, @TomMcTague reports:
social.seo_title: Jeremy Corbyn Is Like Donald Trump, Not Boris Johnson

results.title: What Warren’s Attack on Billionaires Reveals
results.dek: The candidates who have tried to be as smart in public as they are in private have not fared well.

social.share_text: "I have been pessimistic about Warren’s chances," @gcaw writes, "not because of her anger, but because of her apparent lack of a crucial quality that distinguishes successful presidential candidates, namely that they should be completely insane."
social.seo_title: What Warren’s Attack on Billionaires Reveals

results.title: Stop Trying to Raise Successful Kids

image.alt_text: illustration of goldfish arranged in a heart shape

results.dek: And start raising kind ones.

social.share_text: “Parents are supposed to leave a legacy for the next generation, but we are at risk of failing to pass down the key virtue of kindness,” write @AdamMGrant and Allison Sweet Grant. “How can we do better?”
social.seo_title: Teaching Kids Kindness Prepares Them for Success

results.title: My Friend Mister Rogers

image.attribution: Puppet: Andy Gent; photograph: Grant Cornett; prop styling: Anna Surbatovich

results.dek: I first met him 21 years ago, and now our relationship is the subject of a new movie. He’s never been more revered—or more misunderstood.

social.share_text: “What would Fred Rogers—Mister Rogers—have made of El Paso and Dayton, of mass murder committed to fulfill the dictates of an 8chan manifesto?” @TomJunod reflects on his friendship with the children’s-TV host, now the subject of a new movie.
social.seo_title: Mister Rogers’s Enduring Wisdom

results.title: Fox News Covered the Impeachment Hearings in the Fox Newsiest Way Possible

image.caption: Donald Trump watches Fox News. And Fox News watches itself being watched.

results.dek: The network that helped put Donald Trump into power is now showing how insistently it will work to keep him there.

social.share_text: Fox News helped put Donald Trump into power, @megangarber writes. His impeachment hearings are revealing how insistently the network will work to keep him there:
social.seo_title: How Fox News Is Covering Impeachment Hearings

results.title: The Second Moon Landing Was Much Rowdier

image.caption: The Apollo 12 astronauts (from left) Dick Gordon, Pete Conrad, and Alan Bean
image.alt_text: The Apollo 12 astronauts (from left) Dick Gordon, Pete Conrad, and Alan Bean

results.dek: With a successful first mission in the books, the crew of Apollo 12 was under less pressure.

social.share_text: “Did you ever see those pictures of giraffes running in slow motion? That’s exactly what I feel like.” The second moon landing had a very different vibe from the first, @marinakoren writes:
social.seo_title: The Second Moon Landing Was Much Rowdier

results.title: Deval Patrick Says He’s Right on Time

image.alt_text: Deval Patrick enters The Bridge Cafe in Manchester, New Hampshire.

results.dek: The former Massachusetts governor is a talented politician. Is he too late to prove that to primary voters?

social.share_text: “I don’t have any illusions about how hard it is,” Deval Patrick told @IsaacDovere of his last-minute campaign. “But others shouldn’t have any illusions about my resolve.”
social.seo_title: Did Deval Patrick Launch His 2020 Campaign Too Late?

results.title: The Enemy Within
results.dek: Our grasp on what it takes to sustain a democracy is slipping.

social.share_text: Have we taught our children the principles that citizens of this democracy must live by? James Mattis asks. Do we even remember those principles ourselves?
social.seo_title: James Mattis on the Enemy Within

results.title: We Are Running Out of Air

image.caption: A white foam of chemical pollution blankets New Delhi's Yamuna river.
image.alt_text: A white foam of chemical pollution blankets New Delhi's Yamuna river.

results.dek: One suffocating city is a harbinger of health crises around the world.

social.share_text: New Delhi is in the middle of a public-health crisis, and its implications for the world are ominous, writes @jameshamblin:
social.seo_title: The Delhi Air Crisis: What It Means for the World
